senses.de: Something that lasts a long time and isn't damaged easily.
senses.ex: The car tyres are durable and can last for years.

Tips.title: Wear and Tear
Tips.description: Use 'durable' when an item can withstand damage from daily use.
Tips.example: These durable shoes have survived many hikes.

Tips.title: Product Lifetime
Tips.description: 'Durable' suggests an item will last longer than others of its kind.
Tips.example: I bought a durable backpack for college.

Tips.title: Value for Money
Tips.description: A durable item is often seen as good value, as it doesn’t need frequent replacement.
Tips.example: This durable tablecloth was well worth the price.

senses.de: In economic terms, a product that is not consumed immediately but is used over a longer period.
senses.ex: Refrigerators and cars are considered durable goods.

Tips.title: Not Consumable
Tips.description: In economics, 'durable' means an item isn't used up quickly and serves over time.
Tips.example: Investing in durable goods can be cost-efficient.

Tips.title: Investment Items
Tips.description: Durable goods are often pricier, as they're seen as investments, not short-term buys.
Tips.example: Many businesses prefer purchasing durable equipment.

Endure.wordDefinition:
Endure means the ability to withstand hardship or difficult conditions. For example, a person can endure a long hike in the mountains despite being tired and uncomfortable.

Durable is applicable when talking about physical objects that need to last a long time, while endure is applicable when talking about people or things that need to withstand difficult or challenging situations.

Permanent.wordDefinition:
Permanent implies that something is meant to last forever and will not change or go away. For example, a permanent tattoo will always be on the skin and cannot be easily removed.

Durable is applicable to things that need to withstand wear and tear, whereas permanent is applicable when something needs to last forever.

Reliable.wordDefinition:
Durable means that something is strong and long-lasting, whereas reliable means that something can be trusted to work as expected.

Reliable is applicable when talking about something you can depend on, like a reliable car that will always start when you need it to.

Resilient.wordDefinition:
Resilient means something or someone that can bounce back or recover quickly from difficult situations or challenges.

In simple terms, something that is durable can last a long time, while something that is resilient can recover quickly from challenges.

Robust.wordDefinition:
Robust is used when talking about something that can withstand a lot of force or pressure without breaking. For example, a robust piece of furniture will be able to support a lot of weight without falling apart.

If you want something that will last a long time, you would look for something that is durable. If you want something that can handle a lot of stress or pressure, you would look for something that is robust.

Sturdy.wordDefinition:
The words durable and sturdy both mean that something is strong and can withstand some kind of force or wear and tear.

Sturdy on the other hand, implies that something is strong and well-built, but may not necessarily last as long as something that is durable.

For example, a sturdy table is one that won't easily tip over or collapse under weight.

Durable is a more broad and all-encompassing term, while sturdy tends to refer more to physical strength and stability.

Substantial.wordDefinition:
Substantial refers to something that is large or significant in size, amount, or importance. For example, a substantial meal is one that is big enough to satisfy your hunger and provide enough energy for the day, while a substantial amount of money is one that is enough to make a significant impact or purchase.

Durable refers to the ability to withstand damage and function normally, while substantial refers to the size, amount, or importance of something.

Tough.wordDefinition:
Tough, on the other hand, refers to something that can withstand a lot of stress or pressure, such as a sturdy pair of boots that can handle rough terrain.

If you need something that can withstand rough conditions, you might look for a product that is tough.

But this loss can be prevented through memory consolidation, the process by which information is moved from our fleeting short-term memory to our more durable long-term memory. This consolidation occurs with the help of a major part of the brain, known as the hippocampus.

quotes.Text: We are so isolated in our own little worlds, in our own little geographies, that it's pretty hard to understand where someone else is coming from. And so I think that we have to really think about what that means as a country and, frankly, whether this segregation that we have is durable over the long run.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: J. D. Vance

quotes.Text: It seems to me a worthy goal: try to create a representation of consciousness that's durable and truthful, i.e., that accounts, somewhat, for all the strange, tiny, hard-to-articulate, instantaneous, unwilled things that actually go on in our minds in the course of a given day, or even a given moment.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: George Saunders

quotes.Text: While monetary policy can contribute to growth by supporting a durable expansion in a context of price stability, it cannot reliably affect the long-run sustainable level of the economy's growth.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Jerome Powell

quotes.Text: There's this very vulnerable planet of ours with finite resources. Architects and designers have, I think, a fair responsibility for conserving energy and materials, and making things durable.
quotes.Title: British Journalist
quotes.Name: Robin Day

quotes.Text: In reality, while currency movements can have a significant impact on inflation in other countries, dollar movements have rarely had a meaningful or durable impact on prices in the U.S.
quotes.Title: Indian Economist
quotes.Name: Gita Gopinath

quotes.Text: Whatever possession we gain by our sword cannot be sure or lasting, but the love gained by kindness and moderation is certain and durable.
quotes.Title: Leader
quotes.Name: Alexander the Great

quotes.Text: For the only way in which a durable peace can be created is by world-wide restoration of economic activity and international trade.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: James Forrestal

quotes.Text: Wave after wave of love flooded the stage and washed over me, the beginning of the one great durable romance of my life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Bette Davis

quotes.Text: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: C. S. Lewis

quotes.Text: Another essential to a universal and durable peace is social justice.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: Arthur Henderson
